eg.projects

Interface Configurable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ProjectActions
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractProject, GenericProject, HtmlProject, JavaProject, PerlProject, RProject

    public interface Configurable
    The interface that defines the configuration of a project.

    The configuration depends on a class that defines a window where the settings for a project are entered.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void buildSettingsWindow()
      Builds the settings window depending on the input options required in a project
      boolean configureProject(java.lang.String dir)
      Tries to configure a project based on the entries in the settings window
      java.lang.String getExecutableDirName()
      Returns the name of the directory where executable files are saved.
      java.lang.String getProjectName()
      Returns the name of the project root directory
      java.lang.String getProjectPath()
      Returns the path of the project root directory
      ProjectTypes getProjectType()
      Returns the type of project
      boolean isInProject(java.lang.String dir)
      Returns if the specified directory belongs to the project
      void openSettingsWindow()
      Opens the settings window
      boolean retrieveProject(java.lang.String dir)
      Tries to retrieve a project stored in a preferences file
      void setConfiguringAction(java.awt.event.ActionListener al)
      Sets the ActionListener that is called when the entries in the settings window are confirmed.
      void storeConfiguration()
      Stores the configuration in a preferences file
      boolean usesProjectFile()
      Returns if the project uses a main file that is executed when the project is run

    • Method Detail

      • buildSettingsWindow

        void buildSettingsWindow()
        Builds the settings window depending on the input options required in a project

      • openSettingsWindow

        void openSettingsWindow()
        Opens the settings window

      • setConfiguringAction

        void setConfiguringAction(java.awt.event.ActionListener al)
        Sets the ActionListener that is called when the entries in the settings window are confirmed. The listener calls configureProject(java.lang.String) and assigns or updates the project if the configuration is successful
        Parameters:
        al - the ActionListener

      • configureProject

        boolean configureProject(java.lang.String dir)
        Tries to configure a project based on the entries in the settings window
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory that may be or be contained in the project directory named in the settings window
        Returns:
        the boolean value that, if true, indicates a successful configuration

      • retrieveProject

        boolean retrieveProject(java.lang.String dir)
        Tries to retrieve a project stored in a preferences file
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory that may be or be contained in a stored project
        Returns:
        the boolean value that is true if a saved project could be retrieved

      • getProjectType

        ProjectTypes getProjectType()
        Returns the type of project
        Returns:
        the type of project which is a constant in ProjectTypes

      • usesProjectFile

        boolean usesProjectFile()
        Returns if the project uses a main file that is executed when the project is run
        Returns:
        the boolean value that is true if a main file is used

      • isInProject

        boolean isInProject(java.lang.String dir)
        Returns if the specified directory belongs to the project
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory
        Returns:
        the boolean value that is true if the directory is or is contained in the project root directory

      • getProjectPath

        java.lang.String getProjectPath()
        Returns the path of the project root directory
        Returns:
        the directory

      • getProjectName

        java.lang.String getProjectName()
        Returns the name of the project root directory
        Returns:
        the name

      • getExecutableDirName

        java.lang.String getExecutableDirName()
        Returns the name of the directory where executable files are saved. This directory, if given, is deletable in the project explorer.
        Returns:
        the name, the empty string if no such directory is given

      • storeConfiguration

        void storeConfiguration()
        Stores the configuration in a preferences file
